questions.subject: Biology
questions.question: What is the basic unit of life?
questions.explanation: The cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of life.

questions.subject: Biology
questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of living organisms?
questions.explanation: Living organisms grow, respond to their environment, reproduce, and have metabolism. They do not have static composition.

questions.subject: Biology
questions.title: Amazing Cell Fact
questions.fact: A single human cell contains about 6 billion base pairs of DNA, which if stretched out would be about 2 meters long!

questions.instruction: Match each organelle with its primary function:

pairs.definition: Produces ATP energy for cellular processes
Controls cell activities and contains DNA
